persNote: ﻿the Noviceship for the country is kept here

NOTES: ﻿No longer an active institution, now a whiskey museum. Here is info on its history: https://www.jesuits.org/our-work/shmr/what-we-have-learned/st-josephs-college-bardstown-kentucky/ ; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spalding_Hall
courses: ﻿The branches actually taught, are the languages, viz: Latin, Greek, French and Spanish, Mathematics, Latin and English Versification: Rhetoric, including composition and elocution, Mental Philosophy, Natural Philosophy, including the elements of Chemistry, Pneumatics, Electricity, Experimental Philosophy, History and Geography, with the use of the maps and globes, are taught with particular attention.
